com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl.io

Class HighPerformanceLogEntryBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl.io.HighPerformanceLogEntryBatch

  • public final class HighPerformanceLogEntryBatch
extends Object
    Class which represents a log entry batch.

    Batching writes to the filesystem is a well known way of achieving higher throughput when the size of each chunk is a multiple of the underlying block size. This class is designed to handle the management of a single batch of leg entries.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HighPerformanceLogEntryBatch

        public HighPerformanceLogEntryBatch(int capacity)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The log entry batch capacity in bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the batch entry.

        This effectively destroys all log entries in the batch.

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the current batch size.
        Returns:
        The current batch size in bytes.

      • add

        public long add(BytesSegment logEntry,
                long filePosition)
        Add a log entry to the batch.

        Note that either the entire log entry is written to the batch or none if it is. The concept of adding partial log entries to the batch is not supported.

        Parameters:
        logEntry - The log entry.
        filePosition - The file position of this log entry.
        Returns:
        The total number of bytes added to the batch, or 0L if there is insufficient remaining capacity in the batch for the entire log entry (in which case 0 bytes are added).

      • relocateFilePositionsRelativeToZero

        public void relocateFilePositionsRelativeToZero()
        Rewrite the file position of all log entries contained in the batch such that they become relative to a 0 initial position.

        File positions are calculated on the fly as log entries are added and are correct unless the log entries end up being written to a different file other than that expected at the start of the batch. This situation occurs when a rollover of the log file is required after log entries are added to the batch but before it is written to disk. The rollover invalidates the previously calculated file positions. This method allows for an adjustment after such a rollover.

      • write

        public void write(RandomAccessFile file)
           throws IOException
        Write the contents of the batch to the specified file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error writing to the file.
